text: Vom Fass in der Brauerei - Dunkelbraune, fast schwarze Farbe, cremiger, fester Schaum. Unglaublich intensive Aromen von Kaffee, Schokolade und getrockneten Früchten. Etwas Rauchmalz. Relativ trocken-herber Abgang. Sehr süffig für solch einen gehaltvollen Bock.

Vom Faß in der Schalander-Hausbrauerei, Berlin. - Schwarzbraun mit leichtem Rotton, sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase dunkles Malz, Rosinen und eine kräftige aber elegante Mokka-Note. - Im Antrunk erstaunlich schlank mit kräftiger Kaffeenote, elegant aromatisch bitter durch holzige Hopfenherbe. Erinnerte an ein Stout, obwohl untergärig. Dezente Malzsüße und eine fein spritzige Säure. Für einen Bock ungewöhnlich schlank aber von kremiger Fülle. Im Abgang mittlere, leicht holzige Hopfenherbe. Längerer, kaffeebitterer Nachtrunk. - Angenehmer, elegant röstmalz-aromatischer Bock mit sehr schönen Kaffeearomen, perfekt ausbalanciert und überhaupt nicht dick. Ausgezeichnet!
Draught @ the brewpub. Really good wibterbock with heavy notes of coffee and chocolate. Long roasted aftertaste.

Draught @ Schalander Wirtshausbrauerei, Baenschstrasse 91, Friedrichshain, Berlin Germany 10247.Clear dark red brown colour with a large, frothy to creamy, excellent to good lacing, fully lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, moderate chocolate, light licorice. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121220]

On tap at the brewpub. Black colour with a red hue, off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, liquorice, ash, coffee beans, tar, quite sweet. Flavour of hard roasted malts, coffee, medium sweet, toffee, light ashy. Light-bodied, slightly over-carbonated, but quite tasty, almost stout-like.
The head is robust, the body almost black. It smells coffee and malty. The taste is creamy, coffee, aromatic. In the beginning a bit roasty-sour, nice! Very tasty! 12/13/12/12/-/12

Draught at the brewpub.
Dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Malty aroma of hay, bread and caramel with notes of dark chocolate.
Malty flavour of caramel, bread and dark chocolate with notes of alcohol.
Malty and warming alcoholic finish.

Draught. at the brewpub. Black with a beige head, looks a bit like a Baltic porter. Roasted malt aroma. Flavour is roasted fruit and malt with a creamy background. Carbonation at the front of the mouth but level on the throat. Very drinkable.
Reddish-brown. Looks nice. Caramel and light earth on the nose.  Smooth, soft, well-balanced bock with dark sugar notes.

Draft @ brewpub. Beautiful deep burgundy, a very dark and rich hue. Enticing and the loveliest looking of all the house beers. Lovely malt aroma. Not as fruity as expected but in a good way, more toasty malts, which are similar in character to the house dunkles. Nice carbonation level and quaffable palate. Excellent body. Smooth flavors. Not too much of anything. Finishes dry but has excellent malt flavors. Balanced, great.
On tap at the brewpub. Full of lovely malt flavour, bread, some dark fruit. On the sweet side, but there is a discreet bitterness in the finish.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted to breadish malty. Toffee to liqourice dark malty. Lasting dark malt and liqourice flavoured. Mild sweetness. Light bitterness.
